website_summaries.verdict: This trackball mouse can also be used whether you're right-handed or left-handed and has some great customization features.
pros: The software allows you to program the buttons and adjust the cursor and scrolling speeds
The unique scroll ring is easy to use and doesn't tire your hand
Compatible with Windows and Mac computers
cons: Several buyers noted that the trackball gathers dust and dirt more quickly than other brands, which requires more regular cleaning

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse that I'm buying again
customer_reviews.text: I've used this same trackball for several years (bought it in 2012 or 2013, I forget which) - bought it to stop my carpal tunnel wrist issues. It's only just starting to have glitchy problems (not holding drag'n'drops even after alcohol cleaning of all the workings). I'm a heavy user - 10-12 hours x 5-6 days a week of lots of word processing, spreadsheets, accounting, etc. - so I'm quite happy that I haven't had to replace it before now. It has survived my wear and tear and the odd (light) coffee spill. I added a pillow to support my wrist in a more ergonomic way, but otherwise nicely designed.
customer_reviews.author: G.Wells

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics just not right
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it, but I don't. My go to for over a decade has been the Logitech Trackman Marble -- love it's ergonomics, but it doesn't have a scroll capability, so I tried the Kensington Orbit. Pros: - large smooth fingertip ball - easy to use scroll ring Cons: - buttons are placed too far forward on the mouse body relative to the ball, requiring me to release the ball and slide me hand forward for each mouse click. (see photos) - buttons are very stiff, requiring too much effort to click I'm sending it back and trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ring scroller is surprisingly natural and intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: I like and prefer trackballs over mice or touchpads. I've had many different ones over the years. Some with scroll wheels some without. This is the first time I have one with a ring scroller (the ring surrounding the trackball). My finger are already on the trackball so I barely have to move my finger to scroll. My one critique is the button positions are a little farther away than I prefer given how little I have to move to access the trackball and the ring scroller. It is early so I am still getting used to the trackball, but everything else has been easy and intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Review after 6 months of usage
customer_reviews.text: If you never used trackball mouse. It takes few days to get use to. Its not as accurate as regular mouse. I purchased one for home and one for work. After using it for few months I noticed that my pointing finger gets stiff after all day use. Sometimes to a point that it hurts when I try to stretch it out. I also noticed that after months of use. Left side button seems to not respond to presses, unless I hit it harder. Not sure if the button mechanism wears out after constant use. At some point I'm probably going to go back to regular mouse as I'm worried that finger stiffness might become permanent.
customer_reviews.author: PiO

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Logitech Trackman Marble user. Last year when one of them died (after 10 years of daily use), I took a chance on this Kensington unit. I love the scroll wheel and the fact that the roller ball is anchored into place. However, each time my computer goes to sleep, it loses the trackball. On wake, my cursor will not move and sometimes doesn't even appear until I unplug and replug the trackball. I've tried using different USB ports, with a hub, without a hub with the same result. After using this unit for a year, I've decided to return to the tried and true Logitech unit.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Down

customer_reviews.title: Great trackball eases De Quervain's
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with tendonitis in my thumb and De Quervain's in my wrist. I switched to the trackball due to the issues I was having using a regular mouse. I have found that using the trackball has helped immensely. I tried the Kensington Expert Trackball K64325 and personally prefer this one as it is much more comfortable for my hand and less bulky. This trackball moves smoothly and with accuracy. I've had this mouse for over a year with no issues and still works great. The grip pad on the bottom have started to give some and let it slide around my desk but other than that it is my only complaint with this mouse. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Scrolls like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Logitech trackball mouse for years, but recently changed from a Mac to an HP Pavillion, and my Logitech mouse scrolling options changed with my new computer. Scrolling became very awkward. So, I thought I’d give this highly rated Kensington a try. I was skeptical. It didn’t look like it would be as comfortable to rest my hand on as the Logitech, and I figured the scroll wheel would be herky-jerky and I’d end up sending it back. Nope. It’s just as comfortable to rest my hand on as the Logitech—maybe more, and the scroll wheel is smoooooth as butter. I love this thing. So glad I made the change.
customer_reviews.author: Sleonhard

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be reset after screen saver comes on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an ancient Logitec trackball, because this new one has a scroll wheel. What I like about this is that it is wired (I don't want to fool around with batteries) but I like the working of my old track ball better. For this new one, I feel the working of the scroll wheel is only OK. Now the bad. Every time the screen saver activates, the trackball freezes. If I unplug it and reinsert, it recovers. As a result I do not recommend this trackball for MAC Users. (I am running High Sierra on an older iMac).
customer_reviews.author: R. Andorod

customer_reviews.title: Loving this mouse so far.
customer_reviews.text: I got the grey ball version and I'm loving it so far. I had a Logitech marble mouse which was terrific except for it missing the scrolling option so I returned it and got this one and the scrolling wheel works nicely. I'm using it with a MacBook Pro. It doesn't function as well as an apple mouse which pairs really well and the movements are just so precise, but this mouse is cheaper, I don't have to move it around, and I wanted something wired since the bluetooth mouse was disconnecting all the time and driving me insane. I think this is gonna be my workhouse mouse. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Pandalu

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought to supplement my Logitech M570. Build quality is decent, trackball is much heavier than that of a M570, scroll wheel is good to. You can configure the two buttons to perform three different functions with the provided software (clicking both buttons at once can perform a different action). Don't have enough experience with this yet, but initial impression is good.
customer_reviews.author: Potate

customer_reviews.title: Great trackball ~ great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Kensington products. The Orbit Trackball with Scroll Ring works amazing with every application I use as a Digital Media Producer. I am always bouncing from app to app while I design or edit video. The programable buttons can be customized differently for each app. Having a scroll ring allows me to not have to click (both) buttons in order to assign the drag/scroll feature - now I can use those buttons for other functions. This trackball is ergonomic and comfortable, plus the added wrist rest alleviates wrist fatigue. A bang for your buck! Priced at under $30 and fully customizable, I highly recommend the Kensington Orbit Trackball with Scroll Ring.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Novisedlak

customer_reviews.title: yes it is wired
customer_reviews.text: Every high ranked wireless mouse I have bought, has glitched. I ditched the wireless and went to a wired connected mouse and I love it. Down side, it has a big footprint, so I had to move my key board around so it fit next to it. Another downside, is that my hand gets tired if I have to use it for hours at a time. Its not the design per-say, it's how I hold my hand when I have to scroll and click a lot of information. This was 100% worth the price. As a side note my father's old version of this mouse still works after 15 years!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Trackball for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a trackball to replace my Wacom Bamboo Stylus that finally died after 14 years (they don't offer a replacement int he same price range anymore). So I decided to go terackball for my audio editing needs. This is a great trackball. It tracks accurately to screen position, the buttons and scroll wheel are pretty sturdy, and monthly cleaning doesn't reveal it's collecting a lot of dust and grime. One thing to remember with trackballs, you need to clean them every month with a dry squeegee swab or cotton swab for best performance and increase its lifespan. If there's more pervasive gunk, dampen the swab with glass cleaner to get the crud off.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Bonkers

customer_reviews.title: Always the same...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one. I love this trackball, but it's always the same problem. Each one I buy lasts about a year or so and then the left click button starts double-clicking on a single click and then it just stops working. Before buying a new one, I open the trackball to make sure nothing has gotten inside the casing, NOPE- NOTHING! Just the same malfunction everytime. I wish I could recommend this because I love this trackeball, hence I keep buying it over and over. I'm now starting to thing that's the idea for Logitech - buy it over and over. After 3, I'm done!
customer_reviews.author: RPatt3

customer_reviews.title: Great overall, need quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for the price. Returned first one I ordered due to scratchy scroll ring - felt as if sand was in it. Ordered second one, no issues. Glad it worked out because for the most part it does everything I need. Typical business + home use, cleaning is simple and frequency on par with other trackballs I've owned. I have an intention tremor and this helps w/accuracy. I have small hands and still found this comfortable, even though trackball is bigger than others I've used. Only remaining issue is the click is very loud, but I'm going to follow online instructions from other users on how to dampen that.
customer_reviews.author: cheri_c

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend to a friend but...
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I had a Kensington trackball for a Mac Quadra 660AV. The ball was literally as heavy as a cue ball and the accuracy and overall feel was awesome. The ball on this one is the size of a ping pong ball and only a little heavier. I like the scroll wheel but sometimes it seems to hang up and will loosen up if you I like the right & left mouse buttons as well. I guess they just don't make them like they used to. I'll keep it as it's so much better than a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price but not as good as the larger trackballs.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a larger, much older Kensington 4 button trackball with this one. It is okay but not great. The ball is too light and too small in diameter so that no matter how much I fiddle with control panels and such the cursor movement is never fluid and precise. The previous, older one was very fluid and very precise so this was a significant difference. I've used it now for quite some time but have never been happy with it. For the price the performance is as expected. I have ordered a new Kensington 4 button trackball with the larger 55mm ball and hopefully it will match the performance of its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Flem Snopes

customer_reviews.title: Good basic trackball
customer_reviews.text: Needed one for work and I didnt have to have drivers installed. You can control it just using the Windows drivers. It suffers the same issues of other trackballs in that junk gets down in the sensors but the ball just pops right out and they sensors are easy to clean with an alcohol pad.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Freezes when Mac wakes from sleep
customer_reviews.text: Every couple days when my iMac wakes from sleep the mouse is completely unresponsive. I have to unplug the USB and plug it back in, then it works fine. I now see this problem reported by others on the web. Contacted Kensington via chat for support, they didn't know how to fix it. Had to return it, which is annoying because I really like the ergonomics of the mouse. KENSINGTON, FIX THIS COMMONLY REPORTED ISSUE!!
customer_reviews.author: Turn the Page

customer_reviews.title: Great Trackball
customer_reviews.text: My desk has been cluttered with papers since forever. There is no real estate to operate a traditional mouse. Have been using trackballs for over 20 years, most of these with the original Microsoft trackball. Have used this Orbit trackball for almost three years with absolutely no issues. I think the scroll wheel is genius. If the movement gets flakey, just pop out the ball and clean the cavity with compressed air, soft cloth and old tooth brush. Good as new. If you use this device for umpteen hours a day, I strongly suggest placing something under your wrist. Keep your wrist raised to avoid that possibility of Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 2010 - still using it in 2019
customer_reviews.text: The Kensington Orbit trackball's inexpensive price can lull someone into thinking that the product is crappy, or no good. But that person would be wrong. I've used this trackball as my daily driver since 2010, and it has performed admirably in all those years. It's definitely more comfortable to use than a standard mouse - the ring moves very fluidly, as does the ball. Periodically (say, once every 2 months), I will clean the unit to keep it free from dust and debris. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Krishna Draws!

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to have one at home and one at work. This is my favorite trackball mouse. I had a need to switch back and forth between hands to accomodate wrist surgeries and found this mouse comfortable and easy to use with both hands. I love the scroll wheel, the style is my favorite among all ergonomic mice I've used. The buttons require more resistance to click than I'd prefer but ultimately the design is comfortable so even with the button resistance it's still my favorite mouse to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Like a marble trackman, but with scroll wheel. Yay!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for maybe a year now. I replaced my trusty Logitech marble trackball and it took me so long to find a replacement. When I switch to my marble for travel, I realize how much I miss the scroll wheel feature of the orbit. There’s a bunch of trackballs on the market but I love my marble trackman, which I’ve had for like a decade plus. It’s the perfect size and durable as heck, and just missing a scroll wheel. The orbit is the closest thing to the marble with a scroll wheel. It’s not as ergo and the scroll wheel sometimes doesn’t work but for the price, I’m super happy.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Ding

customer_reviews.title: A ball to use
customer_reviews.text: I have several track balls on other computers, made by Logitech. They have been very reliable, and are easy to service, should the need arrive. This Kensington is of a slight different design, but seems to work fine. It has taken me a bit of time to get used to the "ring" around the ball that is used for scrolling and other functions, but it seems to work fine. It is a bit larger than the Logitech trackballs, but I prefer this to a mouse, as I have a small area that works better with a trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old track ball same model that was 2 years old. It still works but silly me got a little to aggressive cleaning out the dust and flicked the little steal ball out (which got lost) and it didn't move as smooth with out the little steal ball. works for gaming and editing photos and even drawing. I have recommended for people with decreased dexterity in hands and they love it also. Takes less space and no wrist or kneck issues. Scroll wheel a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Jane DoeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: but it's super smooth and appropriate for the size of the trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I went with this over the Kensington Expert trackball because it looked more ergonomic and was half the price. The ball is smaller than I expected, but it's super smooth and appropriate for the size of the trackpad. SCROLL WHEEL - Not sure why so many people complained about this. The wheel is smooth as butter and has a nice grippy rubber feel to it. It will take me some time to learn to right click with my ring finger, but left click with the thumb isnt too bad. Definitely worth the 30 bucks. It also came with a palm rest which I have been using on and off, not sure which way I like better yet.
customer_reviews.author: John Kingler

customer_reviews.title: Nice trackball, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This track ball has really reduced the fatigue in my hand from using a standard mouse. It can be used with either hand, and the scroll ring works very well. We have 9 work stations in our office that are in constant use and about half of them use this item instead of a mouse. They last about two to three years under constant use and everyone who uses them insist in not going back to anything else. I've personally tried every type of pointing device from touch pads to stylus to all kinds of mice and other track balls to eliminate discomfort, and this one is the one I always come back to.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C Svec

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several Ball Track Mouses to try them out. They where either ergonomically strange, to small or to big with the scroll wheel in strange places. This mouse if simple and easy to use, and the scroll wheel is also simple to use and the mouse is the perfect size. I have huge hands and my palm pits perfect. I added some pictures to give perspective for people with large hands.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for someone but not me
customer_reviews.text: This trackball seems to work well, responsive, and good form factor. The Ergonomics is terrible for my hand. Don't get me wrong the trackball itself is the not the issue here. The front of the trackball is so low in height (compared to the palm height provided by the mouse), my hand had to adjust to create an arc. This immediately causes hand pain for as little as 10 minutes of use. Maybe for some people, definitely not me. I used many other trackballs, for this price, this is not the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Settles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I work all day on the computer, so I was not going to be using a non ergonomic mouse! I love this one because you do not have to move the actual mouse at all! The track ball is smooth and the rotating scroll wheel works great too! It can take some getting used to though. I have it at my husband's computer, and he still has his mouse plugged in too, so I just move mine to the back when I am done with work!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 10

customer_reviews.title: Once you go track, you never go back.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third trackball mouse, and the second one of this particular model. I bought the first about 6 years ago, and it still works fine. I have tried many, and I like this the best for the following reasons: 1- The ball is big 2- The ball in in the center, sticks up high, and is easy to use with any finger. I hate ones that try to get "ergo" and tuck the ball in the side somewhere. Keep it simple. 3- The scroll ring is critical is a must, IMO. Too many models don't have this, or any other scroll options.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Trackball with a scroll ring, but only two buttons
customer_reviews.text: As a trackball, the Orbit is cheap and while comfortable, has nothing really outstanding. The scroll ring is what put this trackball above the rest. The ring goes around the ball itself, so it can be easily "scrolled" by your finger(s) already on the trackball. The problem is with only two buttons, you'll end up moving the ball with your middle finger instead of your index finger, and that may not be as comfortable. If you have the money, get the 4-button "ExpertMouse" model, but that's more than twice as expensive as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Reviews Romance and MoreTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Terrific and great quality ergonomic mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Ball is very durable, have dropped it numerous times and still works. To clean, simply pop balls out and take dry tissue inside. Very simple. Very accurate sensors, mouse cursor never skips. The mouse itself does not move and stays perfectly still no matter how fast or logn you use it. Excellent scroll ring, comfortable to use and never breaks or gets gunked up! Only small thing that i didn't like was that the buttons are a bit short.Takes a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well...!!!
customer_reviews.text: i immediately installed this item as soon as i received it. the trackball movement is smooth as silk and sensitive (haven't adjusted anything as of yet)! the wrist support is of great help! having carpal tunnel myself, it is a great relief... the buttons are sensitive enough. the scroll ring comes in very handy - no need to push/click the arrows on the screen to get from top to bottom and vice-versa. OVER-ALL A GREAT PRODUCT. i only gave 4-star on the durability issue which has yet to be proven... will review again said rating as time goes by...
customer_reviews.author: allan trajano

customer_reviews.title: The Scroll Ring Nails It!
customer_reviews.text: I'm lovin' this mouse. The scroll ring is a HUGE plus that sets this apart from others. It makes quick scrolling SUPER fast and efficient in websites, spreadsheets, Word docs, etc. I do prefer a thumb trackball over this finger trackball, but after getting used to the change, it's not a problem. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because the right-click is the challenge to master. But again, the scroll ring more than makes up for the right click deficit. If Kensington can make a thumb trackball w/ scroll ring, then the left/right clicks will be super intuitive for the fingers, and this would make the PERFECT mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Jason A Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable and can use it while sitting on the couch...
customer_reviews.text: I like the ring that surrounds the trackball for ease of pulling down windows and sliders. And I like sitting on the couch and putting the trackball on a hard surface and just moving the ball around. Real nice for a couch potato... Just one thing the mouse does better... Selecting, cutting and pasting.... I cannot make the trackball do this as nimbly and nifty as mouse... But I sitll love the trackball...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great functionality, not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The good news is that I like these mice so much that I've purchased 3 of them. The bad news is that the left-click button on 2 of them has stopped working. That's too bad, because the pointing and scrolling functionality of these mice is superior, especially at the price. One tip if you decide to purchase despite the shortcomings: the mouse is light and slides around on some work surfaces, but if you put a dab of Blu Tack or something similar on the bottom, you can fix that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Its my second one. The marble is of medium size.The scroll ring functions well. Once broken in the scroll ring smooths out and the ball also moves more freely. When im away from my computer and have to use a standard mouse. All i can think is how not efficient they are compared to a trackball. And even though this Kensington Orbit is considered a cheap option. It functions brilliantly. And given some breaking in time it gets even better. Another thing is, Its 100% Ubuntu Linux compatible. Plug and play. Ive owned a Logitech Marble and a Kensington wireless. Both functioned well. But this cheaper Orbit has become my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: AlTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, comfortable control.
customer_reviews.text: Squeezing my hand over a mouse has become uncomfortable, compared to manipulating a ball and keeping my hands relatively flat. I had used the larger Kensington, but that is a little less easy to carry in a bag for travelling, as it takes more room and the marble control ball can fly out. This one is smaller, and the ball is somewhat captured so it will not 'run away' if transported.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Junky scroll wheel, poor ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: I used a Logitech trackball mouse for years until the buttons started failing. Super-duper comfortable and tracked perfectly. I can't find a way to get my hand comfortable on this Kensington jobber and a day of work leaves my lower palm in pain. Plus, the scroll ring - while well-placed - doesn't spin smoothly and regularly skips. I would have bought a second Griffin scroll wheel instead, but they were out of stock. The trackball works fine, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mr JFern

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to a desk mouse for Carpal Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: At age 47 I finally started to develop carpal tunnel after using Desk Mice for gaming and I.T. work the past 30+ years. This trackball has saved me from causing further damage and needing surgery. It's precise and very ergonomic, my carpal tunnel is in the tendon that runs from my thumb to my wrist and I am unable to use a thumb trackball but this one worked great, I just inverted the buttons so I don't have to use my thumb to click.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Purchased the original Kensington orbit trackball (Without scroll) used for many years and loved it
customer_reviews.text: Figured I would try this new Orbit trackball with scroll, the scroll was a nice upgrade, but otherwise I was wrong, This Model is not as ergonomic as the original orbit Without trackball it’s too wide and includes A very tall detachable palm rest that makes it even more uncomfortable Unsure what size hand would actually fit this product
customer_reviews.author: Donald P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I love this trackball mouse! Its an Awesome product. The over all size is a bit large but the ball it self is perfect and smooth. I use this mouse for Photoshop, FL Studio and my music software so once I got used to using it, it has benefited my workflow. Also the best part is the scroll wheel. Its location and ease of use works great when editing music. Absolutely best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Works for left and right hand.
customer_reviews.text: This trackball works regardless of me using my left or right hand. I like to switch back and forth. It also has a long chord and is a practical alternative to laptop trackpads that get in the way of typing.
customer_reviews.author: bbb

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable for me. I prefer a trackball to a mouse and for years used a different manufacturer's model that is no longer available. I have tried several different designs by several different manufacturers with the now common "ball between the buttons" layout and have not found any of them to my liking. On this one I frequently had to press the buttons multiple times before getting a response. The need to download software and press both buttons in order to drag an object seemed to be unnecessary. The scroll ring is a nice touch, however. It looks like I'll be using a mouse from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Switches
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second one of these. First one lasted quite a while then clicking became a hit or miss proposition. Micro switches wearing out? I dunno. Now my second one is suffering the same fate, far too soon. Quality is not up to the same standard of Kensingtons other track ball (the red ball with 4 buttons, where scrolling is spinning the ball). I have one of those at work, and it see far more use and is not showing signs of crappy switches.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rauch

customer_reviews.title: Best trackball for the price you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my music production laptop running Pro Tools. Before this, I just used a mouse. Now I don't know how I lived without it. I tried a few other (Kensington) trackballs but somehow they seemed too large, complicated and I couldn't quite get the right feel. But this one is smaller and even though I have large hands, it works perfectly for me. It was pretty much plug and play and the software is straight-forward. Using it is a breeze and at this price, you'll be very surprised and happy with it. I've used it heavily and extensively for the past year and there is no sign of wear, tear, wearing out or performance drops.
customer_reviews.author: efu671

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a marble trackman and it's much better. with the added extension, it's a good height for my hand. the ball smoothness is nice and seems to not get as much dust as the trackman. the scroll ring is good. I would like more buttons ( e.g. 2 to 3 porogrammable buttons per side would be perfect ! ).. I installed the kensington app ( using a mac ) and sometimes, after I reboot, the app doesn't come up. I notice because i set my scroll ring to scroll in the "non default" mac direction. But after I unplug/plug the USB port, the problem goes away.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very good device.
customer_reviews.text: This is a verey good device. It's accurate and nice. You need to get accustomed to it, because it works in a very different form a mouse.I always loved trackballs, but until now I never found one for left-handed persons. This is not really a trackball for left-handed's but for ambidextrous. One thing I would appreciate, is "steps" for the displacement ring, like the regular mouse wheels. When you rolls the mouse wheel, you feel "bumps" fore each posicion. There are no bumps for the ring. Every other aspect is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Gerval

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great for day-job
customer_reviews.text: Swapped a right-handed laptop trackpad for a left-handed trackball and couldn't be happier. If you're suffering from carpel tunnel or similar in your dominant hand, switch to a trackball on the opposite hand. Reverse the left/right buttons in Settings, and you're good to go. Your brain will associate "primary click" with "index finger" on the opposite hand. Enjoy not having to ice your wrists after a day of knowledge work. No good for gaming at all, but great for coding.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping arthritis and pranksters at bay
customer_reviews.text: There are several reasons why I love this product: 1. It is very responsive (touchy), which deters strangers from trying to use my computer to mess with my stuff while I walk away to get coffee or cry. This responsiveness also makes it great for delicate computer rendering. 2. The scroll wheel is awesome for looking at buzzfeed, and also for doing actual work. 3. The blue ball (ha) is swirly like a bowling ball, and that makes me happy. 4. My wrist no longer makes that weird grinding noise at the end of a day of heavy computer use.
customer_reviews.author: Julia L.W. Detwiler

customer_reviews.title: Hated this!
customer_reviews.text: I went from a Logitech trackball to this. I needed a wired mouse per my work security protocols. I thought I would give it a try. It took me 1 day to get used to my trackball so I figured, I wouldn't have too much of a problem. Oh boy! I was completely wrong. It went back within a few days later. It wasn't just getting used to the new mouse, the ball was stiff and scroll ring was almost impossible to move. The buttons buttons also didn't work right and stuck.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredHsMom

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive, convenient, and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I had Carole tunnel some years ago, and using a trackball was part of my recovery plan. It uses small finger movements rather than larger arm movements and it made a huge difference. I love this particular style, and have one at work and one at home. The scroll ring is intuitive, convenient, and efficient. That’s the highest praise I can give anything.
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Hadacek

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Eh. It works well, certainly, and is both solidly constructed and inexpensive, but I found it to be pretty uncomfortable, so I stopped using it after a few months, and caved and bought the more expensive apple magic trackpad, which is just so much better and more comfortable. In my opinion this actually hurts your wrist more than a standard mouse even, just because of the place you rest your hand way pretty uncomfortable and unnatural, which kind of defeats the purpose of buying a trackball. I'd skip this one, but it is cheap, so you might want to try it and see if you like it.
customer_reviews.author: Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Best for arthritis and/or limited mobility.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device because I could no longer use a mouse. I also have trouble moving my thumb. I can easily use the center ball with a slight touch and it takes little effort to click the right button with either the index finger or the thumb. I especially love the scroll ring, which eliminates extended drag and drop actions. I bought this several years ago and I am getting a new one. I use it ten to fifteen hours a day. I am sure that the issues I am having now are simply from age and dirt. Truely a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A Laster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent designed mouse
customer_reviews.text: My last Kensington trackball mouse was more than 20 years ago I thought I am too rusty on using trackball mouse once again. I was wrong. It's so easy to use and with the scrolling wheel makes it even easier. I feel like I've been using this mouse for years. Love the design and brings back a lot of good old memories 👍
customer_reviews.author: Gclancer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand using regular mouses. I hate sliding my hand around the table, and I hate how you have to pick up the mouse from time to time and hunt for the cursor. This roller-ball mouse solved those problems: the base of the mouse never moves. You just roll the ball around with your finger--or scroll with the scrolling ring that sits outside the ball. I switched the button setting so that I just tap the right button with my middle finger to complete an action. It's far more comfortable than any gaming mouse I've ever used, and it's much easier to control.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Levine

customer_reviews.title: The best mouse ever invented
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best mouse ever invented. I do a lot of mouse-work at my job, and was having a lot of pain in my hand from using the traditional style mouse. I tried a couple other ergonomic and trackball mice before finding this one. It's been a Godsend. I like it so much that when I changed jobs, I bought another one for my new job. I've never had a problem with it, you just plug it in and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: ButterflyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this trackball. I used trackballs almost exclusively for many years to create fine details in online design work. I gave them up with Microsoft stopped making the one I really liked and was unable to find a replacement that worked for me. I have a Logitech trackball, but their software compatibility with the Mac seems inconsistent and a pain in the butt. I've got back to corded and I'm glad I did. Took me a while to get used to the Kensington scroll wheel, but find it very intuitive now that I've had a chance to play with it. I hope to keep this one around for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bastoky

customer_reviews.title: It's really not ergonomic at all -- I like to switch between left- and right-handed use so the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's really not ergonomic at all -- I like to switch between left- and right-handed use so the options were limited, but it's actually easier to use my right-handed Logitech left-handed than to use this thing. The clicking is awkward and I miss the back-forward keys. I did end up keeping it because it was getting close to the end of the return window before I decided my hand was never going to adapt, and it is sort of useful for scrolling left-handed if I am eating something messy with my right hand.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Van Gopher

customer_reviews.title: Kensington quality!
customer_reviews.text: I went to a trackball probably 20 years ago after seeing them used in audio mastering facilities due to hand, wrist and shoulder pain from using a mouse and have never looked back nor had any discomfort since with some heavy computer usage. In all that time this is only my third Kensington trackball. They work great and hold up excellent under daily heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Agnello

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable alternative to a traditional mouse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trackball device out of frustration dealing with moving a mouse on a dual monitor configuration. It does take a couple days of adjustment, but it is very comfortable on the wrist and highly accurate. The scroll ring is a great feature. After using for over a month, would not go back to a mouse on my system.
customer_reviews.author: David V

customer_reviews.title: Replaced old one bought February 2015
customer_reviews.text: I use this trackball on a Windows PC and was bummed when the right-click button stopped working. It's only when I ordered a new one that I realized it had been nearly 5 years since I bought the original. I use the mouse with both hands to save my wrists, which both have mild tendonitis for the past twenty years (I also wear an IMAK RSI SmartGlove), and love the speed and responsiveness of the trackball and buttons. As a five-year user, I can confidently recommend the Kensington Orbit.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Hannah

customer_reviews.title: really large - not for small hands
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the teen to use a trackball, to prevent the wrist problems that occur with a flat mouse. I ended up giving her my trackball and using this one. its great if you do not have small hands, ( mine was a logiteck marble mouse--- bought around ten years ago and its still working.)
customer_reviews.author: Vintage PowerReader

customer_reviews.title: Love this trackball but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I use the Kensington Expert Trackball at work but thought I'd save a bit of money and space and get this for home use. Nice space saving trackball but the durability is terrible, this is my second one and after less than a year the left click is already failing. The first one lasted almost 2 years which while not great was somewhat acceptable. Considering I've had the same Expert Trackball for many years and it's being used 40+ hours a week in a demanding environment it's disappointing that this little one is failing with considerably less use. Ordered the Expert Trackball to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: dB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I can only use the roller ball mouse, the other one is not comfortable for me. This particular mouse has an extension at the back that is not pictured and wonderful for my carpel tunnel. I have been sitting at my computer for three hours and I didn't even realize it. My hand did not get numb. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Phearitige

customer_reviews.title: Best index-finger trackball mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mouse for years, and it's now my favorite trackball mouse. I like that it comes with a built-in scroll wheel, which works out-of-the-box on Windows, macOS, and Linux, so you don't have to fight around with configuring extra buttons to do PageUp or PageDown (or whatever). It just works. If you use the mouse as heavily as I do, though, then the buttons will eventually start to stick a bit and require a really forceful push of the thumb in order to register. My solution is to just buy lots of copies of this mouse! I have a drawerful of them. Since it's the best index-finger trackball mouse I've found so far, I really can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trackball - works perfectly with Linux - FAST scrolling
customer_reviews.text: I love the scroll wheel in the middle. Its different from my old trackball so it took a little getting used to - but now, the scroll wheel lets me navigate so much faster. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't have a third button. I use this exclusively with Ubuntu Linux and Linux makes excellent use of the middle button on three button mice/trackballs. All in all though - I'm extremely pleased with this. Excellent if you have wrist pain.
customer_reviews.author: EricInDayton

customer_reviews.title: Scroll Wheel Gets In The Way
customer_reviews.text: The scroll wheel is wildly touch-sensitive. I had to learn to reposition my hand, because I was constantly bumping it and tossing the screen into the stratosphere. This is especially annoying if your boss is watching you use the computer. I am a programmer, and my boss now thinks I lack basic computer skills. (It's a great quality and long-lasting Kensington product, actually... just definitely get the one without the stupid, evil scroll wheel.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian H Estep

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. My company provided this exact one at work and when I was moved to work from home I decided to buy the same one. It's easy to use, comfortable, and my wrist pain went away after using it for a couple of days. I love that it has a scroll wheel around the ball because some ergonomic mice don't have scroll wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlea Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Scroll ring too easy to bump, otherwise, great
customer_reviews.text: The scroll ring has raised ridges that are close enough to the ball that I periodically bump the ring unintentionally when I'm using the ball, even after a year of use. It can be annoying when you move to another slide unintentionally while doing other detail work, but if you prefer a trackball, it is a serviceable model that doesn't hurt my wrist, moves smoothly, and scrolls smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Catalina v. 10.15.1
customer_reviews.text: I have used this trackball for years and absolutely love it but when I upgraded my operating system. . . poof, it stopped working. After spending 30 minutes on the phone with Kensington customer service they finally said that it just doesn't work with the latest Mac OS and I should just wait until their software team finishes working on their new version (the Kensington website lists Mojave as the most recent compatible OS). I asked when that would happen and they said they don't know. So... If you have a Mac running Catalina I would think twice before buying this. Otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L

customer_reviews.title: Dependable trackball old schoolness
customer_reviews.text: I love this trackball. I had one for years until it died recently (this after a LOT of use), I went on Amazon and presto, a new one delivered to my door in a day. I would prefer one that Microsoft sold about 15 years ago but alas, it is no longer available (for any reasonable price) so I switched to this one. I can't live without my old school track ball.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Day

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kensington trackball mouse (my first one is the same model as well). My first one died after a few years of use. I am generally happy with this product so I decide to get another one. My only complaint is that even though this is sold as an ergonomic product, it does not come with any accessories that enable tenting of the mouse, which is helpful in reducing forearm pronation. Luckily, this problem is not too difficult to fix. I used cardboard to make a small stance that props up one side of the mouse, now it’s very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Snoring hippo

customer_reviews.title: this isn't bad, and in some ways I feel is superior ...
customer_reviews.text: If you already have RSI, just know that this won't magically solve your problems. ALL computer peripherals, in my experience, lead to problems *eventually*. That said, this isn't bad, and in some ways I feel is superior to the Logitech thumb track mouse. I don't really enjoy the scroll wheel though, it doesn't provide a slick experience in my opinion. It lacks a middle button, so no quick easy way to close tabs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It's The Bomb
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother in law as he needed a new mouse. The one he had was causing some carpel tunnel like symptoms. Having the ball on the top with the option of clicking on the right or left side works better for him. When I asked him if he liked it, his response was "It's The Bomb" Guess it was a success
customer_reviews.author: Rosiekra

customer_reviews.title: Weird to work with
customer_reviews.text: I like the thought of this mouse but found it awkward. The spinny part was challenging as was the middle finger trackball. I'm used to a thumb trackball so trying to get adjusted to this was challenging, especially for working with spreadsheets and graphic design.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: The left-click button lasts less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Being one of the best trackball mice I ever owned (ergonomically and easy to use), the left-click button conked out in less than a year of use. As a developer I used this mouse every work-day. In less than a year of usage, the left-click button started acting up. It would double-click when I click once. The click would release itself when I try to drag and drop windows. It basically became unusable and totally unreliable. I love this mouse but at this point I don't trust Kensington products and won't replace it with another Kensington mouse. I believe this to be planned obsolescence. They produce inferior products in order to get higher sales.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a mouse that would relieve the tension a regular mouse presented on my thumb. I have only been using this for a few hours but already it feels better than before. Pros - less pressure on my thumb! The scrolling wheel is an amazing feature. Cheap. Cons - It is a little hard to use at first, but the learning curve is not too difficult - I'm still working out some precision problems. The trackball is a bit on the tall side - I have a feeling the higher end Kensington Trackball is better, but at 3 times the price I'll have to wait and see if this tall position is not something I can work with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Audio Production tasks
customer_reviews.text: I spend at least 40 hours a week using a computer for digital recording/audio production. After only a week, I was completely adapted to using a trackball and will NEVER go back to using a standard mouse again. It's more accurate, faster, and the scroll wheel is flawless. No more picking up the mouse and smacking it around all over the mousepad to get the cursor where it needs to go... Seriously, I used to get occasional hand cramps and wrist pain after hours of working on music, but that's not a problem any more.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Needs to Be Replaced Every Year
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Kensington Trackball Mouse. The only drawback is that they only last about one year with the heavy use I give them before starting to have problems like double-clicking when I single-click. I love them so much that I keep buying them every year.
customer_reviews.author: Keith D. Thompson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: If Captain Queeg had a marble like this excellent trackball mouse, he might not have cracked up.
customer_reviews.text: These corded mouses (mice) are hard to find. Glad Kensington is still making it. I prefer a trackball, it is much easier on my wrist. I still have my old one, which now goes into my travel bag. Sometimes you have to clean the ball (don't we all?) and the optical sensors because body oils pick up small amounts of dust and lint that eventually builds up and blocks the senors and causes erratic performance. It takes less than 10 seconds to pop out the track ball and wipe the sensors off..
customer_reviews.author: Molotov

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse at my desk at work for a few years and I love it. I've been able to do more working from home lately and have been wanting to order one for home too, but kept telling myself I was fine with the trackball I had. But I kept finding myself trying to scroll with the scroll ring so I decided I just finally order one for home. So glad i did! I just ♡ this mouse!! My only wish is that there was a wireless option... hint hint Kensington.
customer_reviews.author: bpz

customer_reviews.title: I love the scroll ring
customer_reviews.text: I love the scroll ring. I don't like the small size of the actual trackball. And I don't like that it's wired -- I didn't realize how difficult it is to find wireless or larger trackballs these days. The small ball -- about the size of a ping-pong ball -- negatively effects my pointing precision. UPDATE: After using this mouse for awhile, Ive actually grown quite fond of it... so much so that I will soon be purchasing a second one, as I seem to have worn out the right click button. I am addicted to the scroll ring, and am still frustrated at the lack of finger-controlled, LARGER trackballs available.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: kinda works
customer_reviews.text: It works as a mouse-device, but that's it. Go download Trackball Works, like the instructions and website order you to do. Then you find out there's NO MORE SUPPORT for these devices. Tough. Your problem, not theirs. Thanks for your money, peasant. Trackball works doesn't 'recognize' the device. But Windows does, so in that manner, it does work, but customizing is quite limited.
customer_reviews.author: larry s

customer_reviews.title: Kensington Orbit Trackball Mouse with Scroll Ring (K72337US) Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this exact trackball now for over 7 years and love it. Next to the old Microsoft Trackball, this is my 2nd favorite. I don't know if this new replacement will give me problems or not, but based upon the old one, I expect it to also be GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Wethouse

customer_reviews.title: Good, but two design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Obviously Kensington is the most respected name in trackballs. The orbit trackball is a fairly comfortable layout. The hand rest does not quite live up to the Kensington brand name. It is fairly stiff, and the arch shape puts continuous pressure on the center of my wrist. (1st star lost) Scroll wheel placement works. The wheel moves smoothly, but it is not smooth scrolling. It scrolls a few or many lines at a time.with lots of dead zone between jumps. Unlike my old microsoft mouse that had one to one scrolling for very precise and adjustable speed movement. (2nd star lost).
customer_reviews.author: Project guy

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied. Great ambidexter trackball
customer_reviews.text: Quite satisfied. Great ambidexter trackball. I use it at Linux desktop. No need for drivers, works as a generic 2-button mouse with scrolling wheel. There is an extra pad for wrist but I don't find it convenient. Maybe it is for big palms. So using without it. But one can find it handy. Scrolling ring is made of smooth rubber and feels great. I had a Logitech Marble Mouse for years before (there are not so many cheap ambidexter trackballs available) and tired of it's combo scrolling imitation and driver problems. I've got wrist pain of its combo scroll. Price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene N.

customer_reviews.title: Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has some issues with registering clicks. The buttons feel like they’re very worn and I’ve had it for a couple of days. Just now, on a restart, the mouse wouldn't work at all. The app required to program the middle mouse click doesn’t pass this command to some games.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works fairly well but they used a cheap switch in the right and left click button that is EXTREMELY loud and anyone around you will complain about. I Only use this when I need to give my hand a rest from my regular mouse which is a delux. The switches are very quiet in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: DougSC

customer_reviews.title: For those of us that prefer a trackball, this is the best ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I have one on every computer I own, total of 6. I particularly like the scroll ring. The ball has to be forcefully removed by pushing a finger thru the hole in the back for cleaning the guides. With the previous model the ball would just fall out if you inverted the trackball, making it difficult to find the ball but a whole lot easier to clean inside.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K Knechtly

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the software will be updated someday?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it will work someday? The software does not work with the newest version of Apple OS. The site says it will be available soon. Maybe then I can enjoy this? It works without but it sure would be nice to have access to all the awesome potential.
customer_reviews.author: B.W.

customer_reviews.title: No good for CAD, no center wheel/ring click
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and compare to my trusted M570, which is great. But found that this is not good for CAD as it has no ability to click the the Center mouse ring (wheel for traditional mice). Gonna have to return it. Never found any specs that emphasized this deficiency.
customer_reviews.author: engineer

customer_reviews.title: Love at first roll
customer_reviews.text: Transitioning to this was stupid easy even though I've never used a trackball before. Downloaded software from the Kensington website and was able to configure it to my liking within minutes. The ball has a sophisticated roll to it and the scroll wheel is a joy to spin. Where have you been all my computing life Kensington Orbit Trackball Mouse with Scroll Ring?
customer_reviews.author: Shazamazon

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without the scroll ring
customer_reviews.text: I really like the scroll ring, makes it easy to scroll up/down pages. The key bounce on the buttons, however, is terrible. Single clicks frequently become double clicks, even with the double click time set way high. The function buttons feel cheesy.
customer_reviews.author: Oak Rapp

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I had severe tendonitis in both elbows and forearms. First I got a thumb trackball, sure enough, my stupid thumb swelled up and started cramping! So I switched to this Kensington. You can't clutch it, eliminating that cause of elbow pain.The scroll ring is amazing. It's also ambidextrous, so I switched back and forth depending which elbow hurt worse (not easy but the pain was that bad). I also have a Kensington Freestyle 2 keyboard, and the combo of that and this trackball mouse finally helped my arm pain abate.
customer_reviews.author: sherrig

customer_reviews.title: works for MANY different things!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! Just got it today and works flawlessly!! I'll give it a while and see what it does. I WILL change this if anything goes wrong. Also works as an arcade spinner!!! Update....... The software for this doesn't work!! The trackball works great as p&p but when you use the app for it it kills the trackball all together! So I took 3 stars away!!! So sick of companies putting out crappy software! Award-winning my 4$$!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: The act of trying to click caused my hand to jolt the cursor. My hand ended of tensing trying to click things. Often it seemed I had to click multiple times for a click to register. And the ball, itself, of the trackball, was too high. All of this caused a lot of hand tension: bad ergonomics (as well, the construction of the mouse felt too light, and cheap). The orb ring was nice, though: that's why I'm giving it two stars, and not just one. I ordered one of the Clearly Superior trackballs: it arrived, and feels BEAUTIFUL, far above this one by bt Kensington. LORD granting, I'm returning this Kensington one.
customer_reviews.author: WClark28

customer_reviews.title: Middle of pack track ball...
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for anything on the computer, surfing the net to playing games. If you're doing something light, it's a fine track ball but heavy mouse use like when you're gaming...comfort has been a issue. I've used a different brand track ball for years but they've lacked scroll wheels or rings so I tried this one. While the scroll ring added some pleasant advantages...for some reason, my thumb & wrist gets fatigued from heavy use despite being designed similar to my old track ball. I can't explain it...slightly wider body causing it, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: J.Rose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scroll wheel
customer_reviews.text: Replacing an old Logitech trackball with similar layout on which I had worn out the left-button. I prefer trackballs, and furthermore, prefer fingertip types over thumb. My old trackball didn't have a scroll wheel, which probably contributed to wearing out the left button. The scroll ring on this is a perfect solution. Button placement is slightly wider than old Logitech, which will take some getting used to, but is probably more ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Brady Cleaver
